meanings.definition: To convert data from a period of time to an annual basis.
meanings.sent1: I will annualise the quarterly sales figures to see the yearly trend.
meanings.sent2: It is important to annualise the financial report for accurate comparisons.
meanings.sent3: Why did the accountant annualise the monthly expenses into an annual picnic budget?
meanings.sent4: She decided to annualise her workout routine to track her progress over the year.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to annualise their study hours to plan for the final exams.

meanings.definition: To calculate or adjust for a yearly rate or amount.
meanings.sent1: The bank will annualise the interest rate to show the annual earnings.
meanings.sent2: Investors need to annualise the returns to understand the yearly growth.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to annualise the recipe ingredients for the big annual dinner.
meanings.sent4: He decided to annualise his savings goal to reach a specific amount by the end of the year.
meanings.sent5: The meteorologist will annualise the temperature data to predict the annual climate patterns.
